name: Omni Bedford Springs Resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The title of this review perfectly sums up our time at Bedford Springs. My wife and I were looking for a place within driving distance of D.C. that we could go for the week to renew our mind, body and romance (oh, and to escape the aftermath of Hurricane Irene). We can look back now and say that Bedford Springs was the perfect choice (even more so when we discovered our house had been out of power the entire length of the trip).
reviews.title: Perfect Days

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Bedford Springs offers exceptional service and facilities at a very affordable price (water is complimentary and the final bill won't bring your stress rushing back). We got a porch room right over the lounge of the Eternal Spa, which I think is the best spot in the hotel. From the rocking chairs on the shared porch you can see the entrance of the hotel on your left, the golf course on the right and, in front of you, the spa garden and the lawn, all set to the backdrop of the mountainside opposite Shober's Run. It's a very serene view.
reviews.title: Best long weekend we've ever had!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I woke up the first morning to enjoy hot chocolate and coffee in the rocking chairs on the porch, serenaded by the sound of the fountains below. We then moseyed down to the spa for our couples massage. We were in for a surprise when we discovered the reason they instructed us to come an hour early: the baths!
reviews.title: Disappointed and Disillusioned

reviews.text: The baths are a self-guided experience through the luxury shower, scented-steam room, hot tub, cold tub, luxury shower and hydrating mist. After that, I didn't think I needed a massage. But the trained hands of the Eternal Spa staff proved there was still a deeper relaxation to achieve. We loved it! And we were back to enjoy the spa the following two days.
reviews.title: A Very Special Place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Mid-week I woke up early to play golf on a beautiful late-summer morning. The course is open, but challenging. The toughest part is learning to putt on the greens that are faster than glass. Quite a change from the patchy greens I'm used to at home. There's no question, this is a luxurious course. The natural grass driving range and short game practice area give it that extra polish, and helped me prepare for an enjoyable round.
reviews.title: You don't have to break the bank to enjoy this piece of living history

reviews.text: We discovered this lovely spot by way of the internet during Hurricane Irene, and it was just a fabulous escape. The locale, the setting, the staff, and all the amenities are top notch, and I have to compliment the front desk staffing (Connie), the Tavern staff, as well as the housekeeping staff (Brenda) for their exceptional service. The history of the property and the authenticity of renovation will blow you away,
reviews.title: A gem

reviews.text: We will surely return soon, it was amazing. Thank you!
reviews.title: Drove out west to escape hurricane and discovered this oasis!

reviews.text: We are self diagnosed hotel "snobs". When we are paying to stay somewhere we want it to be as nice if not nicer than our own home. I am an interior designer in the NYC/Philadelphia area and know good interiors when I see one. This is a GORGEOUS hotel. The pictures don't do it justice.
reviews.title: A very pleasant surprise

reviews.text: I have also been to many spas and this one is top notch. I got a facial that was great. Allow time to enjoy all the spa offers.
reviews.title: Summer Spa Escape

reviews.text: My husband and two three year olds only stayed one night to escape the hurricane, and we will be returning. We packed so much in 24 hrs it felt like a few days. We arrived around 1, wandered around the hotel and got our bearings until 3 at check-in. We stayed on the third floor....room was gorgeous and roomy. Linens were great, customer service was good. We swam outside and had poolside grill service and drinks. Feels very upscale. There are cabanas for hot or cold days. Surroundings are very peaceful and quiet, as are the guests (without being too stuffy). There is a general respect from everyone, even us with our crazy three year old twins.
reviews.title: Timeless Perfection

reviews.text: Historic resort from a century ago that was completely rennovated. Take a walk back in time with all modern conveniences. Great golf course, restaurants, 3 or 4 of them and the spa was awesome. Ask for Jonathan the gentle giant...for your memorable massage
reviews.title: Very nice place in the middle of nowhere

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: That we have stayed at this somewhat pricey resort 5 times is remarkable. We have not stayed anywhere (for a leisure trip) that often - and we almost never spend more than $150 to stay anywhere. But this is a destination. And, if you do your homework, (and save for it) it can be an affordable indulgence.
reviews.title: EARNED #8 in the nation

reviews.text: We have gone there, because it is tremendously relaxing and the food (which has occasionally hit some speedbumps) has been really good. Add a beautiful location full of history, a superior spa experience, lovely pools and a firepit, and you have a really nice vacation. We have visited in the months of March, June, August and December (twice).
reviews.title: Simply Outstanding

reviews.text: We have found the front desk and CS staff to be very accommodating. Whatever we need, they (Connie and Dixie) take care of quickly - extra pillows, fix the fridge, move our room (because of too noisy neighbors...) We almost always end up with a porch with rockers - which I really like having. We now know several staff by name, and most of them remember us from one trip to the next.
reviews.title: Wow !!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Food has been everything from "really excellent," to "needs work" - sometimes in the same trip. Best food experience was December 2 years ago, before the 1796 House became a steakhouse. The creativity of that menu, and the excellent desserts made for one of my top 5 meals ever.
reviews.title: Wonderful ambience, amazing history, great food and spa

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The inn is like returning to a more gentile time in history. The porches with the rockers are a very nice touch as is the afternoon tea and the roasting marshmallows by the firepit in the evening. Because the hotel is a series of original buildings joined together there are a variety of room styles and, if you end up in Anderson, you may have to walk
reviews.title: A piece of history

reviews.text: for what seems like miles to get to your room. Nonetheless, it was a very relaxing and enjoyable weekend. I recommend taking the cooking class! Only real complaint was that the air conditioning was noisy.
reviews.title: Very nice, but expensive.

reviews.text: We did a girls weekend at the Omni Bedford Sprinds Resort and had a really nice time, but it was expensive. The hotel and grounds are beautiful. We did spa treatments, hiked, and laid at the pool. The spa was gorgeous and the relaxation room was a treat, but spa services are pricey. We had dinner the first night in the pub and the food was excellent and the atmosphere more laid back. The second evening we had dinner in the Crystal Ballroom (buffet style) and the food was really good, but there was a wedding reception in the ballroom above and you could hear the DJ. They did give us complimentary wine when we complained. I recommed checking if there is a wedding and if so, try one of the other restaurants on-site. The other downside, if you are looking for a quite, relaxing weekend, there seemed to be a lot of young children. The pool was very active, as well as some of the general areas. Overall we had a very enjoyable time, the hotel was lovely, and the staff was nice and helpful.
reviews.title: Beautiful Resort in a beautiful location.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at Bedford Springs for a couple of nights and loved it. The hotel is beautiful, clean and elegant. The beds were incredibly comfortable. The food at the restaurant was delicious and the two pools were great. Would definitely recommend this hotel. Great place to get away from it all.
reviews.title: Hidden Gem

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We visited Bedford Springs on our way to a family reunion in Pittsburgh, and we're so glad we did! Picked it primarily for the golf course which is rated #1 in public courses in PA. Loved the golf course and the resort! Rooms were spacious with ultra comfy bedding and sparkling clean bathrooms. The resort has an amazing pool area, and although we didn't use it, the indoor pool looked like a great place for family fun. Lots of little reading nooks were available for rainy days, and we appreciated the free WiFi. Definitely a place we'll come back to!
reviews.title: Comfortingly opulent and in an intimate rural setting with the best spa

description: Conveniently located within a two hour drive of Washington, DC and Pittsburgh, PA the Omni Bedford Springs is the ideal destination for rejuvenation. The resort recently completed a $120 million restoration and features 216 elegantly appointed guest rooms and suites. This historic resort boasts the number one golf course in Pennsylvania, the 30,000 square foot Springs Eternal Spa, 20,000 square feet of flexible meeting space, 5 restaurants, two pools, 25 miles of hiking trails and a variety of other on-site activities.
